event_registry_properties.name: action
description
event_registry_properties.item: Excessive input power warnings were detected
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The power supply detected excessive AC input fluctuations indicating problems with the power input to the unit. The external power system should be evaluated to prevent loss of service. As this is an indicator of an external condition; verify that you power source(s) are stable and that your connections are secure.

If no problem is found then follow the steps below to obtain the necessary data for presentation to your authorized service provider.

Step 1: Collect the fault message.
A single line fault message is displayed to the system console and logged in the /var/logs/message file. The complete message may be retrieved by using the 'fmdump' command on the XSCF console as shown below.

Example:

LEGEND:
RED = SUNW-MSG-ID
BLUE = EVENT_ID
GREEN = FRU

XSCF> fmdump -m
   MSG-ID: IOXSCF-8000-SC, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 06:06:03 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: BE80601000, HOSTNAME: server-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 61298103-cafa-4e12-b7cb-dff5d36c6fa2
   DESC: Excessive input power warnings were detected
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/IOXSCF-8000-SC for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: No immediate action is taken
   IMPACT: There is no impact to the system
   REC-ACTION: Check AC input power

Step 2: Collect the "fmdump" output.
Use the fmdump command with the Event-ID option to retrieve more information on the fault which has occurred.

Example:

XSCF> fmdump -v -u 61298103-cafa-4e12-b7cb-dff5d36c6fa2
   TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
   Mar 27 06:06:03.4868 61298103-cafa-4e12-b7cb-dff5d36c6fa2 IOXSCF-8000-SC
       100% fault.chassis.iox.env.power.warning
       Problem in: hc:///iox=983392/ps=0
       Affects: -
       FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassisid=BE80601000:server-id=server-
0:serial=T00560:part=3001701:revision=02/component=IOX@X031/PS0

Step 3: Provide the output collected to your service provider. The information collected above will help your service provider to schedule a repair at your convenience.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: There is no impact to the system
event_registry_properties.name: response
title
